metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14612 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 4.17.10. There is aninvalid pointer dereference in btrfs_root_node() when mounting a craftedbtrfs image, because of a lack of chunk block group mapping validation inbtrfs_read_block_groups in fs/btrfs/extent-tree.c, and a lack of empty-treechecks in check_leaf in fs/btrfs/tree-checker.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1106-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1106.114
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1110.115
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1079.89
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1055.60
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1043.49
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1021.23~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
